website_summaries.verdict: A comfortable double self inflating pad for camping partners.
pros: Durable and comfortable micro brushed polyester top shell
Large double size comfortably accommodates two
Comes with carry bag for fuss-free portability
cons: Folding can be difficult due to added size
Probably not the best choice for backpacking

customer_reviews.title: Great Camping Pad
customer_reviews.text: This pad is awesome despite the fact that you might have to blow it up a bit. We are somewhat seasoned car campers that gave it up due to aging - we are 50+ - and sleeping on the ground not an option - compact car so no room for additional stuff. This bag is supper compact when deflated - although a bit bulky and large for hiking and backpacking. We slept so comfortably and it helped keep us warm through our temp drops - gotta love Oregon! Highly recommend for car campers or seasoned backpackers who can carry extra weight and don't want to slide apart in the night :-)
customer_reviews.author: V. Frankland

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to inflate/deflate. Nice cushioning. We bought these as pads for the pull out sofas in our RV, and our RV guests say the beds are much more comfortable! And they are easy to store when deflated.
customer_reviews.author: AMG

customer_reviews.title: Poor Imitation of a Camp Pad
customer_reviews.text: This camping pad took forever to inflate the first time which was to be expected. However after a full day and a dozen puffs of air, this pad wasn't comfortable at all, even sleeping on my living room floor. I'd expect it to be even less effectiveon the ground in a tent. This isn't my first experience with self-inflating sleeping pads, but this one is unsatisfactory. Lightspeed makes a superior pad but I haven't found a double wide one, hence that's why I tried the king camp pad...my mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Just Me

customer_reviews.title: Expensive Cheap foam mattress
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product hoping that it would be enough to keep you comfortable while sleeping on the ground. I was incorrect, it is filled with a cheap foam that doesnt hold any shape whatsoever so really what is the point of even using it. For $80 I was expecting it to have at least memory foam inside since i can buy a 3 inch memory foam topper for less than this. If your a back sleeper you may find some comfort in this but if not it's going to be painful. This is easily a $30 to $40 dollar product.
customer_reviews.author: Alasdair

customer_reviews.title: Worked Like A Charm
customer_reviews.text: My son has a bad back and needs to sleep on a harder/firmer mattress. Regular beds in my house don't work, so when he was coming to visit with his wife I purchased this in the hopes it would work for both of them, comfort-wise. They were both very happy sleeping on this mattress and now I have a comfortable bed for them when they come to visit!
customer_reviews.author: Kat Parra

customer_reviews.title: The best sleeping pad
customer_reviews.text: It is much more convenient to sleep on this one instead of the regular mattress. A useful advice: do not blow it too hard, otherwise it will become very firm, leave some space instead. Also pillows are very nice and compact.
customer_reviews.author: Vadym

customer_reviews.title: Great pad!
customer_reviews.text: We have a class B motor home with a couch that makes into a bed. We needed to cover the seams so it would be more comfortable. This works perfectly to even out the sleeping area. I did try it out on the floor and it was comfortable--much better than sleeping on the ground. It is a little bigger rolled up than we thought it would be, but fits in the provided bag easily.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: We use this to augment the bed cushion in our pop up truck camper. It self inflates enough to where no extra air is needed. I definitely wouldn't back pack this thing anywhere but for two people car camping it fits the bill great. We bring our home pillows so the ones included aren't necessary but the kids enjoy them.
customer_reviews.author: cow dog

customer_reviews.title: We camp in our woods.
customer_reviews.text: It was just as described and since my camping buddy is my boyfriend and we are 58/60 years old, we thought it comfortable and it was better than the hard rocky yards.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Kelding

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Took it camping.. laid it on top of rocks, and didn’t feel the rocks at all. Very comfy but please do refill the air the next day as it does deflate a little
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping pad
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeping pad!! we went camping and some areas were rough and because you can put air inside it feels more like a little mattress that a pad!!! One the best camping item that i have and love it!
customer_reviews.author: Pretola

customer_reviews.title: Travel Mattress
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping pad worked well to help smooth the edges with our Travel Trailer couch. When we turn the couch to a bed, this pad helped make the bed a bit more comfortable. No matter it's still a travel trailer fold out bed and not the most comfortable thing but it helped with a spot for guests to crash.
customer_reviews.author: Erich Kertzscher

customer_reviews.title: It loses air sooner than later...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mattress to place it on top of my Tempurpedic so I can enjoy firmness and lightness during my sleep, given that the Tempurpedic had lost its firmness and it started giving back pain. It was perfect for three months--that is 90 days. I needed to add air to it perhaps every 7 days. That was as long as my happiness lasted. Now I must add air every single day, otherwise, I wake up on a deflated piece of plastic. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Grace

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The first one we ordered was awful and had a hole right by a valve which meant as soon as you sat on it, it deflated. We decided to reorder and give it a try. The second was not much better as the “self inflating” mattress did not inflate very well. In order to really obtain an inflated mattress we have to blow into the valves which took forever and was not worth the price or time.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Great Investment
customer_reviews.text: This product is overall very good. We have only used it for two trips at this point; however, it was a game changer. Very comfortable, easy set up, easy breakdown.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Russell

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality self-inflating camp pad. We use it on our pop up double bed size bunk and it works great, providing the right amount of added cushion for the mattress that we already have. We like that it also protects the camper mattress from anything wet/dirty as it's easy to wipe down.
customer_reviews.author: Shonnie

customer_reviews.title: Just how I hoped it would be
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat compact, seems durable, and I slept well on it. I've only used this once, and I hope it holds up well. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazononian

customer_reviews.title: Great for you money.
customer_reviews.text: This is not the thickest mat but it does the job. The tri zone works pretty well. I don’t use the pillow because it’s not that comfy. I had one for over a year now and about ten camping trips. It hasn’t leaked crossing my fingers. Just bought another one since my family got bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Meas

customer_reviews.title: Nice mat, only used it once so can't comment on durability.
customer_reviews.text: It's really nice for the money and as good as some that cost two or three times as much. I returned it only because it was a bit too big. Measure twice, cut once. Oh well. I'll be ordering a smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: mw

customer_reviews.title: Good size
customer_reviews.text: Slow to inflate. A little bit thin. But that might be because I weigh 210 lbs:-)
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Standefer

customer_reviews.title: Got here on time. Inflation is not a problem ...
customer_reviews.text: Got here on time. Inflation is not a problem. Does not stay inflated for more than 24h. Not a big deal. Mine arrived with a big dark stain on sleep side. May be ink. It doesn’t affect the sleep though. It’s ok. Using it outside country at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: kevn

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and pack up
customer_reviews.text: Was nice to have a mat for our camping trip. Was easy setup and pack up was a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: ML 808

customer_reviews.title: Excellnet Camp pad!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use as my bed at home on the floor. This is the best camp pad I have ever used! very roomy for one person anyway. Quality seems very good and no issues. Would by this product again. A great value compared to the thermarest brand pads, and seems just as good or better quality to me.
customer_reviews.author: Donny G.

customer_reviews.title: Does not last
customer_reviews.text: I liked this mattress on our first couple of uses but now it does not hold air. Very dissapointed that it did not last longer. I was not rough with it and kept in its case. I only inflated it in my tent or in my house.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: ... the right thickness pillows are really uncomfortable its way better then the floor
customer_reviews.text: Took a while to get to the right thickness pillows are really uncomfortable its way better then the floor
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Went camping with my husband and our two year old son and it was nice and comfy! Perfect size and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Julie P

customer_reviews.title: Excellent on tent cot
customer_reviews.text: We just finished our first night on the mattress in a double-wide tent cot. It was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: product was horrible and did not work from the day I opened it.
customer_reviews.text: do not purchase this product it does not fill with air and its just as good as sleeping on a carboard box
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Raposo

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. We have 2 and both are so easy and comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Great car camping sleeping pad for 2
customer_reviews.text: Love this sleeping pad, it was really a good deal. I usually buy most of my outdoor gear through REI and known outdoor brands but other reviews convinced me to try this sleeping pad out and I'm glad I did! we are very happy with it for car camping. Comfortable and unlike an air mattress you can't feel the person next to you move. I didn't love the pillows but they are a bonus, the pad alone is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Save your money for something better
customer_reviews.text: Pain to fold up, doesn’t hold air well. Way overpriced
customer_reviews.author: Trevin

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this product at first. I wanted to love it! It's easy to inflate & comfortable. The only issue is... it slowly deflates over time? I will inflate it ALL the way, twist BOTH caps completely closed, & still hours later I find myself lying on the hard wooden planks of our camping bed. SO uncomfortable. It has been this way since the beginning & we regret purchasing it. I suppose it came with a leak or something.
customer_reviews.author: Calton D.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Valves arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: Terrible valves on this. Went to use it the first time and the cheap plastic valves broke opening them. Of course then it wouldn't hold air. Lucky we had an air mattress for backup. Don't buy this cheap pad.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle N Lane

customer_reviews.title: Game CHANGER
customer_reviews.text: I've taken this thing on about 3 different weekend camping trips since purchasing it and it has single handedly improved my camping experience ten fold. This thing is SO comfortable. It turns the ground into something resembling a firm mattress. Can't recommend this thing enough.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Zolnoor

product_meta.title: KingCamp Double Self Inflating Camping Sleeping Pad Mattress Triple Zone with 2 Pillows, Lightweight Foam for Hiking Picnic Outdoor
feature_bullets: 100% Polyester 75d Micro Brushed, Insulating Sponge Filling

Full inflating size is 78” x 51.2” x 1.6”; Packaged Size is 27.6 × 7.9 × 7.9 inches; Weight 4.4 kg / 9.7 lbs. TRIPLE ZONE design makes this pad more comfortable; Made of waterproof and durable 100% Micro Brushed 75D Polyester with insulating sponge filling, it is damp-proof and skin-friendly. Two self-inflating PILLOWS add more comfort.
Comes with two compression straps, an oversized oxford carrying bag and repair kit (Glue Not Included); Essential for camping, hiking, home living and any other outdoor activities

Open the two valves, the pad will inflate itself. Because it is compressed in the bag for a long time, the mattress may inflate slowly. Just a few breaths will make it inflate well. It is recommended that sunlight can make the process faster and better. You can roll it back and forth or use it twice to restore the elasticity of the sponge.

To deflate the pad, **1. Firstly, open the valves, rolling the pad from the bottom, press the rolling part by your legs. When rolling to the top part, let the air flow out for a while, then close the valves. **2. Secondly, don't open the valves, unfold the pad, then rolling the pad again to the top part, open the valves, let the air flow out. Then close the valves. **3. Repeat 2 until you can fold the pad into the carry bag (about 3 - 5 times)

Two durable non-corrosive brass valves provide rapid inflation and deflation. It is convenient to adjust the comfort level of this self-inflating camp pad. And we hope to provide the best experience to all of our customers. Please feel free to let us know if you have any questions or concerns. Our mattresses are one year warranty.
